comment: Everything was pretty well explained and he was easy to communicate with. There's a couple of extra credit opportunities if needed.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor was incredibly condescending every time I had to interact with him. His instructions would be unclear or incomplete, but he would blame the students for his disorganized course. I am finishing my second degree this semester and was really put off by this profes
Professor Perez is very chill. He makes the class very fun and its a safe place to be creative in. Whoever gave him a bad rating needs to touch some grass or get therapy. Pronto.

Perez is a great professor! He counts attendance, so show up to class on time. His assignments are easy to understand, and he's always happy to answer questions about clarification. He lets students resubmit work after it's been graded in order to get a better grade, so it's not difficult to get an A in this class as long as you do the work.

If I got a bad grade, Perez would give me good feedback and fix my grade after I fixed the issues. The class requires Teams and it was difficult and a little overwhelming at the start of the semester to set up and get into the classroom, but after that it was pretty simple to navigate and it got the professor to answer questions very quickly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Pulled me and other classmates outside to lecture us with no hard evidence that we didn't do the work correctly. Likes to nitpick and get onto you for no reason other than to feel superior. Fun class topic, not a good teacher. calls out people he knows are not comfortable with public speaking.

Great professor. He likes to get to know you and clearly cares about your interests. He brings resources to class such as drawing books. Overall cares about his students and wants to make an impact on their art journey. He'll make you will want to change your major to Illustration or Sequential art because of him. The absolute best.

He is very caring and uses most of his classes for studio time. He is not very lecture heavy which I liked and he gives you a lot of room for you to make the projects your own. He does a few demos and walks around to check up on you each class. He is also very straightforward with how he grades so it's not hard to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Tbh I was shocked that Prof Perez's score on here wasn't higher. He's very approachable, cares about students & their interests, checks up on our progress- one of my favorite professors ever! He knows a lot, provides lots of resources if we want to further explore something, and encourages us to explore our own styles. Super professional & fun.

What a guy. Very understanding. Projects are fun, will reach out to check if your ok if you stop showing up, super cool and super chill. Gives us ample time to finish the projects, he does keep you full time. Very social and wants us to interact. He constantly checks up on your progress in class. A pleasure to take so far.

For an introductory painting class it was very difficult and skipped over many basic essentials. He is very harsh with his grading criteria and confusing.Very contradictory in what he wants, what he wants YOU to do and why you got points off. Would not recommend if you actually want to learn something. He's very Unapproachable.

Cares about class participation and attendance. Almost failed because of attendance, so go to class. When grading assignments is very tough and very vague. Lectures are very dry and receptive. Despite all of this, does care about students and wants to teach art.

Carlos is fine but doesn't go through courses before class so you all learn what you are doing together. He is super dry at times and his class is very receptive. He cares a lot about attendance and reports you if you don't show up enough. When he critiques your work he kinda says the bare minimum and its pretty basic stuff.

Uses an online textbook and structures his lectures by walking through the chapters. As a GenEd art course, it can be pretty dry at times. Exams are online and are pretty easy, you will have a few writing assignments that are easy. Class interaction is expected. He cares about the subject and wants his students to as well.
